_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Farmers Mill Inc. handles NH3, we have two stationary sources.  In storage tanks and mobile nurse tanks   We do have emergency shutdowns on the tanks along with excess flow valves as active mitigation.  We also have annual training for our employees and have our Fire Chief visit our site annually.  We have not had a release in the last 5 years on our site.
      Our facilty complies with ANSI Standard K-61 1995 requirements for Anhyrdrous Ammonia storage.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and local regulations.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to immediately notifiy the Protivin Fire Dept. via 911 call.  We would also call the Chickasaw LEPC.  We have planned for emergency situations but in a occurance of a real emergency it will be unexpected and training and planning may not reflect the actual emergency.  The primary contact for Farmers Mill Inc. is Joel Meirick his contact number is in the registration section of this document.  Additional contacts are Mark Meirick 319-240-9549, Dennis Meirick 319-240-6659, Ray Lukes 319-721-8787. 

General Accidental Release Prevention:
This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rules and all applicable State and local codes and regulations.  The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with ANSI Standard K-16. 1-1989 and State Law.
The company does annual training with employees, to have safe operation of equipment.

Five Year Accident History:
Farmers Mill Inc. has not had any accidental release involving anhydrous ammonia in the last 5 years that caused death, injuries, property, or environmental damage. 

Emergency Response Program:
In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammonia system, it is Farmers Mill's policy to notifiy the Protivin Fire Dept and the Chickasaw County LEPC to respond to the emergency.
